A really good story by a community member which you should probably take note of to understand this simply :) Truth #1: The price in stock markets has ‚Äúsurge pricing‚Äù built-in. Truth #2: Humans behave inconsistently and consistently at the same time. Truth #3: The stocks you buy represents actual fractional ownership of a real, living and breathing, money-making entity These 3 truths, when combined together, simply tells you this: The price of the stock you see fluctuates on a daily basis (because of ‚Äúsurge-pricing‚Äù), but once you buy it, you own an actual business with predictable growth. ‚ÄúPrice is what you pay, Value is what you get‚Äù.
